channel.title: Code blocks on FOL
channel.description: Recent content in Code blocks on FOL

item.title: Statements
item.description: The actions that a program takes are expressed in statements. Common actions include declaring variables, assigning values, calling subprograms, looping through collections, and branching to one or another block of code, depending on a given condition. The order in which statements are executed in a program is called the flow of control or flow of execution. The flow of control may vary every time that a program is run, depending on how the program reacts to input that it receives at run time.

item.title: Expressions
item.description: An expression is a sequence of operators and their operands, that specifies a computation. It is a sequence of one or more operands and zero or more operators that can be evaluated to a single value, object, subprogram, or namespace. Expressions can consist of a literal value, a subprogram invocation, an operator and its operands, or a simple name. Simple names can be the name of a variable, type member, subprogram parameter, namespace or type.
